featured.text: It consists of a piece of rubber, plastic, leather, or woven material in the outline of a foot, with a strap holding the sandal to a wearer’s toes.
This is certainly good news for cash-strapped students.
The straps on the heel and toe control the length of the shoe, 25 the two on either side allow for different widths.

other.text: What does the word “cash-strapped” in the second paragraph mean? (A) Making a lot of money.
In the Greek version, the toe strap ran between the first and second toes, while Roman sandals had the strap between the second and third toes.
The Mesopotamians wore the strap between the third and fourth toes.
The innovative footwear resembles a common sandal and is made of leather straps and rubber soles, a material similar to that used in tires.

definition.zh_def: 帶子；繩子，通常用於固定或攜帶物品。
definition.en_def: A strip of material used to fasten, secure, or carry something.
definition.example: She used a strap to hold her bag tightly.
